abilitygroupdescription.p: Transport abilities involve riding horses, driving carts and the operation of boats and ships.

abilitydescription.p: The character has experience caring for animals. Particularly farm animals and horses. They can read the mood of natural animals and they can diagnose and treat common ails.

This represents the ability to drive a cart. Under normal circumstances this ability need not be checked. Make a check on muddy roads, in the event of broken axles or harnesses, when trying to drive the cart fast or when the cart is overloaded.
The ability to ride a horse, and possibly other animals.
Masters are navigators. They learn to plot a ships course, first through local waters and then across the chartered oceans.

At low ranks the character is a pilot. They know one particular area; a river, bay or harbour; particularly well. They know the local myths pertaining to that place and are able to navigate ships within that area safely in normal weather conditions. The character has spent a lot of time in the presence of sailors from ports around the world. They have sea/river lore for all the bodies of water commonly sailed by the men with whom they have spoken.

At rank three the character is a Master navigator. They have passed some theoretical and pratical tests to obtain a certificate from a guild at no small pecuniary cost. They have the ability to navigate a ship using charts, the stars and/or dead reckoning.
Sailing involves the use of a ship. This ability includes the use of small craft and galleys. At higher ranks the character has experience with large craft crewed by dozens of sailors.

At rank four the character is capable enought to perform a role requiring significant ability within the ship a mate or a boatswain, quartermaster, etc. At fifth rank the character is able to perform the role of Captain of a medium to large ship has a lot of experience on the water is is naturally adept as a sailor. The characters exploits and knowledge garner him respect from fellow sailors.
